plant.models.full.dynamics¶

Source: src\plant\models\full\dynamics.py

Module Overview¶

Full Fidelity DIP Dynamics Model.

Complete high-fidelity implementation of the double inverted pendulum with all nonlinear effects, advanced numerical integration, and comprehensive physics modeling.

Complete Source Code¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#========================= src/plant/models/full/dynamics.py ==========================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Full Fidelity DIP Dynamics Model.
  7
  8Complete high-fidelity implementation of the double inverted pendulum
  9with all nonlinear effects, advanced numerical integration, and
 10comprehensive physics modeling.
 11"""
 12
 13from __future__ import annotations
 14from typing import Tuple, Optional, Dict, Any, Union
 15import numpy as np
 16import warnings
 17
 18from ..base import BaseDynamicsModel, DynamicsResult
 19from ...core import (
 20    DIPStateValidator,
 21    NumericalInstabilityError,
 22    NumericalStabilityMonitor
 23)
 24from .config import FullDIPConfig
 25from .physics import FullFidelityPhysicsComputer
 26from src.utils.config_compatibility import AttributeDictionary, ensure_dict_access
 27
 28
 29class FullDIPDynamics(BaseDynamicsModel):
 30    """
 31    Full Fidelity Double Inverted Pendulum Dynamics Model.
 32
 33    High-fidelity implementation featuring:
 34    - Complete nonlinear dynamics with all coupling effects
 35    - Advanced friction models (viscous + Coulomb)
 36    - Aerodynamic forces and wind effects
 37    - High-precision adaptive integration
 38    - Comprehensive disturbance modeling
 39    - Research-grade numerical accuracy
 40    """
 41
 42    def __init__(
 43        self,
 44        config: Union[FullDIPConfig, Dict[str, Any]],
 45        enable_monitoring: bool = True,
 46        enable_validation: bool = True
 47    ):
 48        """
 49        Initialize full-fidelity DIP dynamics.
 50
 51        Args:
 52            config: Validated configuration for full DIP model or dictionary
 53            enable_monitoring: Enable comprehensive performance monitoring
 54            enable_validation: Enable detailed state validation
 55        """
 56        # Handle config parameter conversion
 57        if isinstance(config, dict):
 58            if config:
 59                self.config = FullDIPConfig.from_dict(config)
 60            else:
 61                self.config = FullDIPConfig.create_default()
 62        elif isinstance(config, FullDIPConfig):
 63            self.config = config
 64        elif isinstance(config, AttributeDictionary):
 65            # Convert AttributeDictionary to dict and create FullDIPConfig
 66            config_dict = ensure_dict_access(config)
 67            if config_dict:
 68                self.config = FullDIPConfig.from_dict(config_dict)
 69            else:
 70                self.config = FullDIPConfig.create_default()
 71        else:
 72            raise ValueError(f"config must be FullDIPConfig, dict, or AttributeDictionary, got {type(config)}")
 73
 74        self.enable_monitoring = enable_monitoring
 75        self.enable_validation = enable_validation
 76
 77        # Initialize base class
 78        super().__init__(self.config)
 79
 80        # Initialize physics computer
 81        self.physics = FullFidelityPhysicsComputer(self.config)
 82
 83        # Setup integration state tracking
 84        self.integration_stats = {
 85            'total_steps': 0,
 86            'successful_steps': 0,
 87            'rejected_steps': 0,
 88            'average_step_size': 0.0,
 89            'min_step_size': float('inf'),
 90            'max_step_size': 0.0
 91        }
 92
 93        # Wind model state (if enabled)
 94        self.wind_state = np.array([0.0, 0.0])  # [vx, vy]
 95
 96    def compute_dynamics(
 97        self,
 98        state: np.ndarray,
 99        control_input: np.ndarray,
100        time: float = 0.0,
101        **kwargs: Any
102    ) -> DynamicsResult:
103        """
104        Compute full-fidelity DIP dynamics.
105
106        Args:
107            state: State vector [x, theta1, theta2, x_dot, theta1_dot, theta2_dot]
108            control_input: Control input [F] (force on cart)
109            time: Current time for time-varying effects
110            **kwargs: Additional parameters (wind_velocity, etc.)
111
112        Returns:
113            Dynamics computation result with comprehensive diagnostics
114        """
115        # Enhanced input validation
116        if not self._validate_inputs(state, control_input):
117            return self._create_failure_result(
118                "Invalid inputs",
119                state=state,
120                control_input=control_input,
121                time=time
122            )
123
124        try:
125            # Sanitize and validate state
126            if self.enable_validation:
127                sanitized_state = self.sanitize_state(state)
128                if not self._check_physical_constraints(sanitized_state):
129                    return self._create_failure_result(
130                        "Physical constraints violated",
131                        state=state,
132                        control_input=control_input,
133                        time=time
134                    )
135            else:
136                sanitized_state = state
137
138            # Extract optional parameters
139            wind_velocity = kwargs.get('wind_velocity', None)
140            if self.config.wind_model_enabled and wind_velocity is None:
141                wind_velocity = self._update_wind_model(time)
142
143            # Compute high-fidelity dynamics
144            state_derivative = self.physics.compute_complete_dynamics_rhs(
145                sanitized_state, control_input, time, wind_velocity
146            )
147
148            # Validate result
149            if not self._validate_state_derivative(state_derivative):
150                return self._create_failure_result(
151                    "Invalid state derivative computed",
152                    state=sanitized_state,
153                    control_input=control_input,
154                    time=time
155                )
156
157            # Comprehensive diagnostics
158            diagnostics = self._compute_diagnostics(sanitized_state, state_derivative, time)
159
160            # Record successful computation
161            if self.enable_monitoring:
162                self._record_successful_computation(sanitized_state, diagnostics)
163
164            return self._create_success_result(
165                state_derivative,
166                state=sanitized_state,
167                control_input=control_input,
168                time=time,
169                wind_velocity=wind_velocity.copy() if wind_velocity is not None else None,
170                **diagnostics
171            )
172
173        except NumericalInstabilityError as e:
174            if self.enable_monitoring:
175                self._record_numerical_instability(state, str(e))
176
177            return self._create_failure_result(
178                f"Numerical instability: {e}",
179                state=state,
180                control_input=control_input,
181                time=time,
182                error_type="numerical_instability"
183            )
184
185        except Exception as e:
186            if self.enable_monitoring:
187                self._record_computation_failure(state, str(e))
188
189            return self._create_failure_result(
190                f"Dynamics computation failed: {e}",
191                state=state,
192                control_input=control_input,
193                time=time,
194                error_type="computation_error"
195            )
196
197    def get_physics_matrices(
198        self,
199        state: np.ndarray
200    ) -> Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray, np.ndarray]:
201        """
202        Get complete physics matrices M, C, G at current state.
203
204        Args:
205            state: Current system state
206
207        Returns:
208            Tuple of (M, C, G) matrices with full nonlinear effects
209        """
210        M = self.physics._compute_full_inertia_matrix(state)
211        C = self.physics._compute_full_coriolis_matrix(state)
212        G = self.physics._compute_full_gravity_vector(state)
213        return M, C, G
214
215    def compute_energy_analysis(self, state: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, float]:
216        """
217        Compute comprehensive energy analysis.
218
219        Args:
220            state: Current system state
221
222        Returns:
223            Dictionary with detailed energy breakdown
224        """
225        # Total energy components
226        kinetic = self._compute_kinetic_energy(state)
227        potential = self._compute_potential_energy(state)
228        total = kinetic + potential
229
230        # Detailed kinetic energy breakdown
231        kinetic_cart = self._compute_cart_kinetic_energy(state)
232        kinetic_pend1 = self._compute_pendulum_kinetic_energy(state, 1)
233        kinetic_pend2 = self._compute_pendulum_kinetic_energy(state, 2)
234
235        # Potential energy breakdown
236        potential_pend1 = self._compute_pendulum_potential_energy(state, 1)
237        potential_pend2 = self._compute_pendulum_potential_energy(state, 2)
238
239        return {
240            'total_energy': total,
241            'kinetic_energy': kinetic,
242            'potential_energy': potential,
243            'kinetic_cart': kinetic_cart,
244            'kinetic_pendulum1': kinetic_pend1,
245            'kinetic_pendulum2': kinetic_pend2,
246            'potential_pendulum1': potential_pend1,
247            'potential_pendulum2': potential_pend2,
248            'energy_ratio': kinetic / (total + 1e-12)  # Avoid division by zero
249        }
250
251    def compute_stability_metrics(self, state: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, float]:
252        """
253        Compute stability and conditioning metrics.
254
255        Args:
256            state: Current system state
257
258        Returns:
259            Dictionary with stability metrics
260        """
261        M, C, G = self.get_physics_matrices(state)
262
263        # Matrix conditioning
264        cond_M = np.linalg.cond(M)
265        det_M = np.linalg.det(M)
266
267        # Eigenvalue analysis
268        eigenvals_M = np.linalg.eigvals(M)
269        min_eigenval = np.min(eigenvals_M)
270        max_eigenval = np.max(eigenvals_M)
271
272        # System energy
273        energy_analysis = self.compute_energy_analysis(state)
274
275        return {
276            'inertia_condition_number': cond_M,
277            'inertia_determinant': det_M,
278            'min_eigenvalue': min_eigenval,
279            'max_eigenvalue': max_eigenval,
280            'eigenvalue_ratio': max_eigenval / (min_eigenval + 1e-12),
281            'total_energy': energy_analysis['total_energy'],
282            'kinetic_potential_ratio': (energy_analysis['kinetic_energy'] /
283                                      (energy_analysis['potential_energy'] + 1e-12))
284        }
285
286    def set_wind_model(self, wind_function):
287        """Set custom wind velocity function wind_function(time) -> [vx, vy]."""
288        self._wind_function = wind_function
289
290    def get_integration_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
291        """Get integration performance statistics."""
292        stats = self.integration_stats
293        if stats['total_steps'] > 0:
294            stats['success_rate'] = stats['successful_steps'] / stats['total_steps']
295            stats['rejection_rate'] = stats['rejected_steps'] / stats['total_steps']
296        else:
297            stats['success_rate'] = 0.0
298            stats['rejection_rate'] = 0.0
299
300        return stats
301
302    def _setup_validation(self) -> None:
303        """Setup enhanced state validation for full DIP."""
304        if self.enable_validation:
305            self._state_validator = DIPStateValidator(
306                position_bounds=self.config.cart_position_limits,
307                angle_bounds=(-8*np.pi, 8*np.pi),  # Allow more rotations for full model
308                velocity_bounds=(-self.config.cart_velocity_limit, self.config.cart_velocity_limit),
309                angular_velocity_bounds=(-self.config.joint_velocity_limits, self.config.joint_velocity_limits),
310                wrap_angles=True,
311                strict_validation=False
312            )
313
314    def _validate_inputs(self, state: np.ndarray, control_input: np.ndarray) -> bool:
315        """Enhanced input validation for full model."""
316        # Basic validation
317        if not self.validate_state(state):
318            return False
319
320        if not self._validate_control_input(control_input):
321            return False
322
323        # Enhanced validations for full model
324        if self.enable_validation:
325            # Check for extreme values that might cause numerical issues
326            if np.any(np.abs(state[3:]) > 100.0):  # Very high velocities
327                warnings.warn("Extreme velocities detected", UserWarning)
328
329            if np.abs(control_input[0]) > 10 * self.config.cart_mass * self.config.gravity:
330                warnings.warn("Extreme control input detected", UserWarning)
331
332        return True
333
334    def _check_physical_constraints(self, state: np.ndarray) -> bool:
335        """Check physical constraints specific to full model."""
336        x, theta1, theta2, x_dot, theta1_dot, theta2_dot = state
337
338        # Cart position limits
339        if self.config.cart_position_limits is not None:
340            if not (self.config.cart_position_limits[0] <= x <= self.config.cart_position_limits[1]):
341                return False
342
343        # Joint angle limits
344        if self.config.joint1_angle_limits is not None:
345            if not (self.config.joint1_angle_limits[0] <= theta1 <= self.config.joint1_angle_limits[1]):
346                return False
347
348        if self.config.joint2_angle_limits is not None:
349            if not (self.config.joint2_angle_limits[0] <= theta2 <= self.config.joint2_angle_limits[1]):
350                return False
351
352        # Velocity limits
353        if abs(x_dot) > self.config.cart_velocity_limit:
354            return False
355
356        if abs(theta1_dot) > self.config.joint_velocity_limits or abs(theta2_dot) > self.config.joint_velocity_limits:
357            return False
358
359        return True
360
361    def _compute_diagnostics(
362        self,
363        state: np.ndarray,
364        state_derivative: np.ndarray,
365        time: float
366    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
367        """Compute comprehensive diagnostics for full model."""
368        diagnostics = {}
369
370        # Energy analysis
371        energy_analysis = self.compute_energy_analysis(state)
372        diagnostics.update(energy_analysis)
373
374        # Stability metrics
375        stability_metrics = self.compute_stability_metrics(state)
376        diagnostics.update(stability_metrics)
377
378        # Physics forces breakdown
379        forces = self._compute_force_breakdown(state)
380        diagnostics.update(forces)
381
382        # Integration quality metrics
383        if hasattr(self, '_last_state') and hasattr(self, '_last_time'):
384            dt = time - self._last_time
385            if dt > 0:
386                numerical_derivative = (state - self._last_state) / dt
387                derivative_error = np.linalg.norm(numerical_derivative[3:] - state_derivative[3:])
388                diagnostics['derivative_consistency_error'] = derivative_error
389
390        # Store for next iteration
391        self._last_state = state
392        self._last_time = time
393
394        return diagnostics
395
396    def _compute_force_breakdown(self, state: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, np.ndarray]:
397        """Compute breakdown of all forces acting on the system."""
398        # Get individual force components
399        friction_forces = self.physics._compute_friction_forces(state)
400        aero_forces = self.physics._compute_aerodynamic_forces(state, self.wind_state)
401        disturbance_forces = self.physics._compute_disturbance_forces(state, 0.0)
402
403        return {
404            'friction_forces': friction_forces,
405            'aerodynamic_forces': aero_forces,
406            'disturbance_forces': disturbance_forces,
407            'total_nonconservative_forces': friction_forces + aero_forces + disturbance_forces
408        }
409
410    def _update_wind_model(self, time: float) -> np.ndarray:
411        """Update wind velocity model."""
412        if hasattr(self, '_wind_function'):
413            self.wind_state = np.array(self._wind_function(time))
414        else:
415            # Default: gentle sinusoidal wind
416            wind_magnitude = 0.5  # m/s
417            wind_frequency = 0.1  # Hz
418            self.wind_state = np.array([
419                wind_magnitude * np.sin(2 * np.pi * wind_frequency * time),
420                0.0
421            ])
422
423        return self.wind_state
424
425    def _compute_kinetic_energy(self, state: np.ndarray) -> float:
426        """Compute total kinetic energy."""
427        return (self._compute_cart_kinetic_energy(state) +
428                self._compute_pendulum_kinetic_energy(state, 1) +
429                self._compute_pendulum_kinetic_energy(state, 2))
430
431    def _compute_potential_energy(self, state: np.ndarray) -> float:
432        """Compute total potential energy."""
433        return (self._compute_pendulum_potential_energy(state, 1) +
434                self._compute_pendulum_potential_energy(state, 2))
435
436    def _compute_cart_kinetic_energy(self, state: np.ndarray) -> float:
437        """Compute kinetic energy of cart."""
438        _, _, _, x_dot, _, _ = state
439        return 0.5 * self.config.cart_mass * x_dot**2
440
441    def _compute_pendulum_kinetic_energy(self, state: np.ndarray, pendulum_num: int) -> float:
442        """Compute kinetic energy of specified pendulum."""
443        if pendulum_num == 1:
444            mass = self.config.pendulum1_mass
445            length = self.config.pendulum1_com
446            inertia = self.config.pendulum1_inertia
447            theta_dot = state[4]
448        else:
449            mass = self.config.pendulum2_mass
450            length = self.config.pendulum2_com
451            inertia = self.config.pendulum2_inertia
452            theta_dot = state[5]
453
454        # Translational kinetic energy of COM
455        com_velocity = self.physics._compute_pendulum_tip_velocity(pendulum_num, state, length)
456        T_trans = 0.5 * mass * np.dot(com_velocity, com_velocity)
457
458        # Rotational kinetic energy about COM
459        T_rot = 0.5 * inertia * theta_dot**2
460
461        return T_trans + T_rot
462
463    def _compute_pendulum_potential_energy(self, state: np.ndarray, pendulum_num: int) -> float:
464        """Compute potential energy of specified pendulum."""
465        _, theta1, theta2, _, _, _ = state
466
467        if pendulum_num == 1:
468            mass = self.config.pendulum1_mass
469            length = self.config.pendulum1_com
470            height = length * (1 - np.cos(theta1))
471        else:
472            mass = self.config.pendulum2_mass
473            length = self.config.pendulum2_com
474            # Pendulum 2 height relative to its attachment point
475            height = (self.config.pendulum1_length * (1 - np.cos(theta1)) +
476                     length * (1 - np.cos(theta2)))
477
478        return mass * self.config.gravity * height
479
480    def _validate_control_input(self, control_input: np.ndarray) -> bool:
481        """Validate control input for full model."""
482        return (
483            isinstance(control_input, np.ndarray) and
484            control_input.shape == (1,) and
485            np.all(np.isfinite(control_input))
486        )
487
488    def _validate_state_derivative(self, state_derivative: np.ndarray) -> bool:
489        """Enhanced validation of computed state derivative."""
490        is_valid = (
491            isinstance(state_derivative, np.ndarray) and
492            state_derivative.shape == (6,) and
493            np.all(np.isfinite(state_derivative))
494        )
495
496        if is_valid and self.enable_validation:
497            # Check for physically unreasonable accelerations
498            max_reasonable_accel = 1000.0  # m/s² or rad/s²
499            if np.any(np.abs(state_derivative[3:]) > max_reasonable_accel):
500                warnings.warn("Extreme accelerations computed", UserWarning)
501
502        return is_valid
503
504    def _record_successful_computation(self, state: np.ndarray, diagnostics: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
505        """Record successful computation with full diagnostics."""
506        if hasattr(self, '_stability_monitor'):
507            cond_num = diagnostics.get('inertia_condition_number', np.inf)
508            self._stability_monitor.record_inversion(
509                condition_number=cond_num,
510                was_regularized=cond_num > self.config.max_condition_number,
511                failed=False
512            )
513
514        # Update integration statistics
515        self.integration_stats['successful_steps'] += 1
516        self.integration_stats['total_steps'] += 1
517
518    def _record_numerical_instability(self, state: np.ndarray, error_msg: str) -> None:
519        """Record numerical instability with context."""
520        if hasattr(self, '_stability_monitor'):
521            self._stability_monitor.record_inversion(
522                condition_number=np.inf,
523                was_regularized=True,
524                failed=True
525            )
526
527        self.integration_stats['rejected_steps'] += 1
528        self.integration_stats['total_steps'] += 1
529
530    def _rhs_core(self, state: np.ndarray, u: float = 0.0) -> np.ndarray:
531        """
532        Compatibility method for legacy code expecting _rhs_core.
533
534        This method provides backward compatibility for code that expects
535        the '_rhs_core' method interface. Maps to the standard compute_dynamics
536        interface.
537
538        Args:
539            state: System state vector [x, dx, theta1, dtheta1, theta2, dtheta2]
540            u: Control input (scalar force)
541
542        Returns:
543            State derivative vector
544        """
545        control_input = np.array([u]) if np.isscalar(u) else u
546        result = self.compute_dynamics(state, control_input)
547
548        if result.success:
549            return result.state_derivative
550        else:
551            # For compatibility, return zeros if computation fails
552            return np.zeros_like(state)
553
554    def _record_computation_failure(self, state: np.ndarray, error_msg: str) -> None:
555        """Record general computation failure."""
556        if hasattr(self, '_stability_monitor'):
557            self._stability_monitor.record_inversion(
558                condition_number=np.inf,
559                was_regularized=False,
560                failed=True
561            )
562
563        self.integration_stats['rejected_steps'] += 1
564        self.integration_stats['total_steps'] += 1
565
566    def _rhs_core(self, state: np.ndarray, u: float = 0.0) -> np.ndarray:
567        """
568        Compatibility method for legacy code expecting _rhs_core.
569
570        This method provides backward compatibility for code that expects
571        the '_rhs_core' method interface. Maps to the standard compute_dynamics
572        interface.
573
574        Args:
575            state: System state vector [x, dx, theta1, dtheta1, theta2, dtheta2]
576            u: Control input (scalar force)
577
578        Returns:
579            State derivative vector
580        """
581        control_input = np.array([u]) if np.isscalar(u) else u
582        result = self.compute_dynamics(state, control_input)
583
584        if result.success:
585            return result.state_derivative
586        else:
587            # For compatibility, return zeros if computation fails
588            return np.zeros_like(state)

Classes¶

FullDIPDynamics¶

Inherits from: BaseDynamicsModel

Full Fidelity Double Inverted Pendulum Dynamics Model.

High-fidelity implementation featuring:

  • Complete nonlinear dynamics with all coupling effects

  • Advanced friction models (viscous + Coulomb)

  • Aerodynamic forces and wind effects

  • High-precision adaptive integration

  • Comprehensive disturbance modeling

  • Research-grade numerical accuracy

Source Code¶

  1class FullDIPDynamics(BaseDynamicsModel):
  2    """
  3    Full Fidelity Double Inverted Pendulum Dynamics Model.
  4
  5    High-fidelity implementation featuring:
  6    - Complete nonlinear dynamics with all coupling effects
  7    - Advanced friction models (viscous + Coulomb)
  8    - Aerodynamic forces and wind effects
  9    - High-precision adaptive integration
 10    - Comprehensive disturbance modeling
 11    - Research-grade numerical accuracy
 12    """
 13
 14    def __init__(
 15        self,
 16        config: Union[FullDIPConfig, Dict[str, Any]],
 17        enable_monitoring: bool = True,
 18        enable_validation: bool = True
 19    ):
 20        """
 21        Initialize full-fidelity DIP dynamics.
 22
 23        Args:
 24            config: Validated configuration for full DIP model or dictionary
 25            enable_monitoring: Enable comprehensive performance monitoring
 26            enable_validation: Enable detailed state validation
 27        """
 28        # Handle config parameter conversion
 29        if isinstance(config, dict):
 30            if config:
 31                self.config = FullDIPConfig.from_dict(config)
 32            else:
 33                self.config = FullDIPConfig.create_default()
 34        elif isinstance(config, FullDIPConfig):
 35            self.config = config
 36        elif isinstance(config, AttributeDictionary):
 37            # Convert AttributeDictionary to dict and create FullDIPConfig
 38            config_dict = ensure_dict_access(config)
 39            if config_dict:
 40                self.config = FullDIPConfig.from_dict(config_dict)
 41            else:
 42                self.config = FullDIPConfig.create_default()
 43        else:
 44            raise ValueError(f"config must be FullDIPConfig, dict, or AttributeDictionary, got {type(config)}")
 45
 46        self.enable_monitoring = enable_monitoring
 47        self.enable_validation = enable_validation
 48
 49        # Initialize base class
 50        super().__init__(self.config)
 51
 52        # Initialize physics computer
 53        self.physics = FullFidelityPhysicsComputer(self.config)
 54
 55        # Setup integration state tracking
 56        self.integration_stats = {
 57            'total_steps': 0,
 58            'successful_steps': 0,
 59            'rejected_steps': 0,
 60            'average_step_size': 0.0,
 61            'min_step_size': float('inf'),
 62            'max_step_size': 0.0
 63        }
 64
 65        # Wind model state (if enabled)
 66        self.wind_state = np.array([0.0, 0.0])  # [vx, vy]
 67
 68    def compute_dynamics(
 69        self,
 70        state: np.ndarray,
 71        control_input: np.ndarray,
 72        time: float = 0.0,
 73        **kwargs: Any
 74    ) -> DynamicsResult:
 75        """
 76        Compute full-fidelity DIP dynamics.
 77
 78        Args:
 79            state: State vector [x, theta1, theta2, x_dot, theta1_dot, theta2_dot]
 80            control_input: Control input [F] (force on cart)
 81            time: Current time for time-varying effects
 82            **kwargs: Additional parameters (wind_velocity, etc.)
 83
 84        Returns:
 85            Dynamics computation result with comprehensive diagnostics
 86        """
 87        # Enhanced input validation
 88        if not self._validate_inputs(state, control_input):
 89            return self._create_failure_result(
 90                "Invalid inputs",
 91                state=state,
 92                control_input=control_input,
 93                time=time
 94            )
 95
 96        try:
 97            # Sanitize and validate state
 98            if self.enable_validation:
 99                sanitized_state = self.sanitize_state(state)
100                if not self._check_physical_constraints(sanitized_state):
101                    return self._create_failure_result(
102                        "Physical constraints violated",
103                        state=state,
104                        control_input=control_input,
105                        time=time
106                    )
107            else:
108                sanitized_state = state
109
110            # Extract optional parameters
111            wind_velocity = kwargs.get('wind_velocity', None)
112            if self.config.wind_model_enabled and wind_velocity is None:
113                wind_velocity = self._update_wind_model(time)
114
115            # Compute high-fidelity dynamics
116            state_derivative = self.physics.compute_complete_dynamics_rhs(
117                sanitized_state, control_input, time, wind_velocity
118            )
119
120            # Validate result
121            if not self._validate_state_derivative(state_derivative):
122                return self._create_failure_result(
123                    "Invalid state derivative computed",
124                    state=sanitized_state,
125                    control_input=control_input,
126                    time=time
127                )
128
129            # Comprehensive diagnostics
130            diagnostics = self._compute_diagnostics(sanitized_state, state_derivative, time)
131
132            # Record successful computation
133            if self.enable_monitoring:
134                self._record_successful_computation(sanitized_state, diagnostics)
135
136            return self._create_success_result(
137                state_derivative,
138                state=sanitized_state,
139                control_input=control_input,
140                time=time,
141                wind_velocity=wind_velocity.copy() if wind_velocity is not None else None,
142                **diagnostics
143            )
144
145        except NumericalInstabilityError as e:
146            if self.enable_monitoring:
147                self._record_numerical_instability(state, str(e))
148
149            return self._create_failure_result(
150                f"Numerical instability: {e}",
151                state=state,
152                control_input=control_input,
153                time=time,
154                error_type="numerical_instability"
155            )
156
157        except Exception as e:
158            if self.enable_monitoring:
159                self._record_computation_failure(state, str(e))
160
161            return self._create_failure_result(
162                f"Dynamics computation failed: {e}",
163                state=state,
164                control_input=control_input,
165                time=time,
166                error_type="computation_error"
167            )
168
169    def get_physics_matrices(
170        self,
171        state: np.ndarray
172    ) -> Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray, np.ndarray]:
173        """
174        Get complete physics matrices M, C, G at current state.
175
176        Args:
177            state: Current system state
178
179        Returns:
180            Tuple of (M, C, G) matrices with full nonlinear effects
181        """
182        M = self.physics._compute_full_inertia_matrix(state)
183        C = self.physics._compute_full_coriolis_matrix(state)
184        G = self.physics._compute_full_gravity_vector(state)
185        return M, C, G
186
187    def compute_energy_analysis(self, state: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, float]:
188        """
189        Compute comprehensive energy analysis.
190
191        Args:
192            state: Current system state
193
194        Returns:
195            Dictionary with detailed energy breakdown
196        """
197        # Total energy components
198        kinetic = self._compute_kinetic_energy(state)
199        potential = self._compute_potential_energy(state)
200        total = kinetic + potential
201
202        # Detailed kinetic energy breakdown
203        kinetic_cart = self._compute_cart_kinetic_energy(state)
204        kinetic_pend1 = self._compute_pendulum_kinetic_energy(state, 1)
205        kinetic_pend2 = self._compute_pendulum_kinetic_energy(state, 2)
206
207        # Potential energy breakdown
208        potential_pend1 = self._compute_pendulum_potential_energy(state, 1)
209        potential_pend2 = self._compute_pendulum_potential_energy(state, 2)
210
211        return {
212            'total_energy': total,
213            'kinetic_energy': kinetic,
214            'potential_energy': potential,
215            'kinetic_cart': kinetic_cart,
216            'kinetic_pendulum1': kinetic_pend1,
217            'kinetic_pendulum2': kinetic_pend2,
218            'potential_pendulum1': potential_pend1,
219            'potential_pendulum2': potential_pend2,
220            'energy_ratio': kinetic / (total + 1e-12)  # Avoid division by zero
221        }
222
223    def compute_stability_metrics(self, state: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, float]:
224        """
225        Compute stability and conditioning metrics.
226
227        Args:
228            state: Current system state
229
230        Returns:
231            Dictionary with stability metrics
232        """
233        M, C, G = self.get_physics_matrices(state)
234
235        # Matrix conditioning
236        cond_M = np.linalg.cond(M)
237        det_M = np.linalg.det(M)
238
239        # Eigenvalue analysis
240        eigenvals_M = np.linalg.eigvals(M)
241        min_eigenval = np.min(eigenvals_M)
242        max_eigenval = np.max(eigenvals_M)
243
244        # System energy
245        energy_analysis = self.compute_energy_analysis(state)
246
247        return {
248            'inertia_condition_number': cond_M,
249            'inertia_determinant': det_M,
250            'min_eigenvalue': min_eigenval,
251            'max_eigenvalue': max_eigenval,
252            'eigenvalue_ratio': max_eigenval / (min_eigenval + 1e-12),
253            'total_energy': energy_analysis['total_energy'],
254            'kinetic_potential_ratio': (energy_analysis['kinetic_energy'] /
255                                      (energy_analysis['potential_energy'] + 1e-12))
256        }
257
258    def set_wind_model(self, wind_function):
259        """Set custom wind velocity function wind_function(time) -> [vx, vy]."""
260        self._wind_function = wind_function
261
262    def get_integration_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
263        """Get integration performance statistics."""
264        stats = self.integration_stats
265        if stats['total_steps'] > 0:
266            stats['success_rate'] = stats['successful_steps'] / stats['total_steps']
267            stats['rejection_rate'] = stats['rejected_steps'] / stats['total_steps']
268        else:
269            stats['success_rate'] = 0.0
270            stats['rejection_rate'] = 0.0
271
272        return stats
273
274    def _setup_validation(self) -> None:
275        """Setup enhanced state validation for full DIP."""
276        if self.enable_validation:
277            self._state_validator = DIPStateValidator(
278                position_bounds=self.config.cart_position_limits,
279                angle_bounds=(-8*np.pi, 8*np.pi),  # Allow more rotations for full model
280                velocity_bounds=(-self.config.cart_velocity_limit, self.config.cart_velocity_limit),
281                angular_velocity_bounds=(-self.config.joint_velocity_limits, self.config.joint_velocity_limits),
282                wrap_angles=True,
283                strict_validation=False
284            )
285
286    def _validate_inputs(self, state: np.ndarray, control_input: np.ndarray) -> bool:
287        """Enhanced input validation for full model."""
288        # Basic validation
289        if not self.validate_state(state):
290            return False
291
292        if not self._validate_control_input(control_input):
293            return False
294
295        # Enhanced validations for full model
296        if self.enable_validation:
297            # Check for extreme values that might cause numerical issues
298            if np.any(np.abs(state[3:]) > 100.0):  # Very high velocities
299                warnings.warn("Extreme velocities detected", UserWarning)
300
301            if np.abs(control_input[0]) > 10 * self.config.cart_mass * self.config.gravity:
302                warnings.warn("Extreme control input detected", UserWarning)
303
304        return True
305
306    def _check_physical_constraints(self, state: np.ndarray) -> bool:
307        """Check physical constraints specific to full model."""
308        x, theta1, theta2, x_dot, theta1_dot, theta2_dot = state
309
310        # Cart position limits
311        if self.config.cart_position_limits is not None:
312            if not (self.config.cart_position_limits[0] <= x <= self.config.cart_position_limits[1]):
313                return False
314
315        # Joint angle limits
316        if self.config.joint1_angle_limits is not None:
317            if not (self.config.joint1_angle_limits[0] <= theta1 <= self.config.joint1_angle_limits[1]):
318                return False
319
320        if self.config.joint2_angle_limits is not None:
321            if not (self.config.joint2_angle_limits[0] <= theta2 <= self.config.joint2_angle_limits[1]):
322                return False
323
324        # Velocity limits
325        if abs(x_dot) > self.config.cart_velocity_limit:
326            return False
327
328        if abs(theta1_dot) > self.config.joint_velocity_limits or abs(theta2_dot) > self.config.joint_velocity_limits:
329            return False
330
331        return True
332
333    def _compute_diagnostics(
334        self,
335        state: np.ndarray,
336        state_derivative: np.ndarray,
337        time: float
338    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
339        """Compute comprehensive diagnostics for full model."""
340        diagnostics = {}
341
342        # Energy analysis
343        energy_analysis = self.compute_energy_analysis(state)
344        diagnostics.update(energy_analysis)
345
346        # Stability metrics
347        stability_metrics = self.compute_stability_metrics(state)
348        diagnostics.update(stability_metrics)
349
350        # Physics forces breakdown
351        forces = self._compute_force_breakdown(state)
352        diagnostics.update(forces)
353
354        # Integration quality metrics
355        if hasattr(self, '_last_state') and hasattr(self, '_last_time'):
356            dt = time - self._last_time
357            if dt > 0:
358                numerical_derivative = (state - self._last_state) / dt
359                derivative_error = np.linalg.norm(numerical_derivative[3:] - state_derivative[3:])
360                diagnostics['derivative_consistency_error'] = derivative_error
361
362        # Store for next iteration
363        self._last_state = state
364        self._last_time = time
365
366        return diagnostics
367
368    def _compute_force_breakdown(self, state: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, np.ndarray]:
369        """Compute breakdown of all forces acting on the system."""
370        # Get individual force components
371        friction_forces = self.physics._compute_friction_forces(state)
372        aero_forces = self.physics._compute_aerodynamic_forces(state, self.wind_state)
373        disturbance_forces = self.physics._compute_disturbance_forces(state, 0.0)
374
375        return {
376            'friction_forces': friction_forces,
377            'aerodynamic_forces': aero_forces,
378            'disturbance_forces': disturbance_forces,
379            'total_nonconservative_forces': friction_forces + aero_forces + disturbance_forces
380        }
381
382    def _update_wind_model(self, time: float) -> np.ndarray:
383        """Update wind velocity model."""
384        if hasattr(self, '_wind_function'):
385            self.wind_state = np.array(self._wind_function(time))
386        else:
387            # Default: gentle sinusoidal wind
388            wind_magnitude = 0.5  # m/s
389            wind_frequency = 0.1  # Hz
390            self.wind_state = np.array([
391                wind_magnitude * np.sin(2 * np.pi * wind_frequency * time),
392                0.0
393            ])
394
395        return self.wind_state
396
397    def _compute_kinetic_energy(self, state: np.ndarray) -> float:
398        """Compute total kinetic energy."""
399        return (self._compute_cart_kinetic_energy(state) +
400                self._compute_pendulum_kinetic_energy(state, 1) +
401                self._compute_pendulum_kinetic_energy(state, 2))
402
403    def _compute_potential_energy(self, state: np.ndarray) -> float:
404        """Compute total potential energy."""
405        return (self._compute_pendulum_potential_energy(state, 1) +
406                self._compute_pendulum_potential_energy(state, 2))
407
408    def _compute_cart_kinetic_energy(self, state: np.ndarray) -> float:
409        """Compute kinetic energy of cart."""
410        _, _, _, x_dot, _, _ = state
411        return 0.5 * self.config.cart_mass * x_dot**2
412
413    def _compute_pendulum_kinetic_energy(self, state: np.ndarray, pendulum_num: int) -> float:
414        """Compute kinetic energy of specified pendulum."""
415        if pendulum_num == 1:
416            mass = self.config.pendulum1_mass
417            length = self.config.pendulum1_com
418            inertia = self.config.pendulum1_inertia
419            theta_dot = state[4]
420        else:
421            mass = self.config.pendulum2_mass
422            length = self.config.pendulum2_com
423            inertia = self.config.pendulum2_inertia
424            theta_dot = state[5]
425
426        # Translational kinetic energy of COM
427        com_velocity = self.physics._compute_pendulum_tip_velocity(pendulum_num, state, length)
428        T_trans = 0.5 * mass * np.dot(com_velocity, com_velocity)
429
430        # Rotational kinetic energy about COM
431        T_rot = 0.5 * inertia * theta_dot**2
432
433        return T_trans + T_rot
434
435    def _compute_pendulum_potential_energy(self, state: np.ndarray, pendulum_num: int) -> float:
436        """Compute potential energy of specified pendulum."""
437        _, theta1, theta2, _, _, _ = state
438
439        if pendulum_num == 1:
440            mass = self.config.pendulum1_mass
441            length = self.config.pendulum1_com
442            height = length * (1 - np.cos(theta1))
443        else:
444            mass = self.config.pendulum2_mass
445            length = self.config.pendulum2_com
446            # Pendulum 2 height relative to its attachment point
447            height = (self.config.pendulum1_length * (1 - np.cos(theta1)) +
448                     length * (1 - np.cos(theta2)))
449
450        return mass * self.config.gravity * height
451
452    def _validate_control_input(self, control_input: np.ndarray) -> bool:
453        """Validate control input for full model."""
454        return (
455            isinstance(control_input, np.ndarray) and
456            control_input.shape == (1,) and
457            np.all(np.isfinite(control_input))
458        )
459
460    def _validate_state_derivative(self, state_derivative: np.ndarray) -> bool:
461        """Enhanced validation of computed state derivative."""
462        is_valid = (
463            isinstance(state_derivative, np.ndarray) and
464            state_derivative.shape == (6,) and
465            np.all(np.isfinite(state_derivative))
466        )
467
468        if is_valid and self.enable_validation:
469            # Check for physically unreasonable accelerations
470            max_reasonable_accel = 1000.0  # m/s² or rad/s²
471            if np.any(np.abs(state_derivative[3:]) > max_reasonable_accel):
472                warnings.warn("Extreme accelerations computed", UserWarning)
473
474        return is_valid
475
476    def _record_successful_computation(self, state: np.ndarray, diagnostics: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
477        """Record successful computation with full diagnostics."""
478        if hasattr(self, '_stability_monitor'):
479            cond_num = diagnostics.get('inertia_condition_number', np.inf)
480            self._stability_monitor.record_inversion(
481                condition_number=cond_num,
482                was_regularized=cond_num > self.config.max_condition_number,
483                failed=False
484            )
485
486        # Update integration statistics
487        self.integration_stats['successful_steps'] += 1
488        self.integration_stats['total_steps'] += 1
489
490    def _record_numerical_instability(self, state: np.ndarray, error_msg: str) -> None:
491        """Record numerical instability with context."""
492        if hasattr(self, '_stability_monitor'):
493            self._stability_monitor.record_inversion(
494                condition_number=np.inf,
495                was_regularized=True,
496                failed=True
497            )
498
499        self.integration_stats['rejected_steps'] += 1
500        self.integration_stats['total_steps'] += 1
501
502    def _rhs_core(self, state: np.ndarray, u: float = 0.0) -> np.ndarray:
503        """
504        Compatibility method for legacy code expecting _rhs_core.
505
506        This method provides backward compatibility for code that expects
507        the '_rhs_core' method interface. Maps to the standard compute_dynamics
508        interface.
509
510        Args:
511            state: System state vector [x, dx, theta1, dtheta1, theta2, dtheta2]
512            u: Control input (scalar force)
513
514        Returns:
515            State derivative vector
516        """
517        control_input = np.array([u]) if np.isscalar(u) else u
518        result = self.compute_dynamics(state, control_input)
519
520        if result.success:
521            return result.state_derivative
522        else:
523            # For compatibility, return zeros if computation fails
524            return np.zeros_like(state)
525
526    def _record_computation_failure(self, state: np.ndarray, error_msg: str) -> None:
527        """Record general computation failure."""
528        if hasattr(self, '_stability_monitor'):
529            self._stability_monitor.record_inversion(
530                condition_number=np.inf,
531                was_regularized=False,
532                failed=True
533            )
534
535        self.integration_stats['rejected_steps'] += 1
536        self.integration_stats['total_steps'] += 1
537
538    def _rhs_core(self, state: np.ndarray, u: float = 0.0) -> np.ndarray:
539        """
540        Compatibility method for legacy code expecting _rhs_core.
541
542        This method provides backward compatibility for code that expects
543        the '_rhs_core' method interface. Maps to the standard compute_dynamics
544        interface.
545
546        Args:
547            state: System state vector [x, dx, theta1, dtheta1, theta2, dtheta2]
548            u: Control input (scalar force)
549
550        Returns:
551            State derivative vector
552        """
553        control_input = np.array([u]) if np.isscalar(u) else u
554        result = self.compute_dynamics(state, control_input)
555
556        if result.success:
557            return result.state_derivative
558        else:
559            # For compatibility, return zeros if computation fails
560            return np.zeros_like(state)
